alert.note: Alert for Bennington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Berkshire, east central Rensselaer and southwestern Bennington Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Williamstown, or 8 miles west of North Adams, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Pownal, Cole Field, Meadowvale, White Oaks, Center Berlin, Blackinton, Pownal Center, Sweets Corner, Weston Field, South Williamstown and Steeles Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
